website_summaries.verdict: An affordable tabletop telescope that's simple enough even for young children to use.
pros: A lightweight, tabletop telescope that doesn't require a lot of packing or unpacking
Comes with a finderscope and two different eyepieces
cons: The image quality probably won't satisfy experienced stargazers

customer_reviews.title: Views of saturn
customer_reviews.text: Great starter scope for kids. Out of the box my favorite eyepiece is the 10mm Kellner. I bought the Celestron 94308 observers accessory kit and by using the blue planetary filter on the 10mm kellner with the 2x Barlow you can see Saturn just below the moon. Switch to the 6mm Plossl eyepiece with the blue filter and the 2x Barlow and you can see Saturn at the size of an eraser head with enough clarity to see the space between the rings and the planet. For the moon the 10mm kellner with the 2x Barlow and moon filter works best. You can very easily see individual craters and canyons. We sit in a city of 50k at 5000 feet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Beginners Telescope.
customer_reviews.text: At this price, this is the best telescope made. Very durable, easy to set up and powerful for a scope at this price. Bought this as a birthday present for my Granddaughter and she has been very happy with it as well as the rest of the family. Please note that the telescope is sold without a finder scope or moon filter which are sold as an accessory kit. There is also a phone camera adapter available which attaches to the eypiece and allows more than one person to observe utilizing the phones camera. I have ordered another one for another Grandchild's birthday and may also get one for myself.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Stevenson

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: This is a great first telescope for my 8 year old. He received this for his birthday and has been obsessed with using it to view stars and the moon. His interest in space and constellations has increased vastly and I love watching him as his mind works to try and make sense of what he is viewing. We did end up purchasing a finderscope which has made it even easier to use. I don't think this will be the last telescope we own, but I am glad that we chose this one as our first telescope!
customer_reviews.author: RiverSong

customer_reviews.title: Great first scope
customer_reviews.text: This was a birthday present for our 9 year old and he just loves it. Keep in mind this is not a professional scope and for the price that shouldn't be surprising. We were able to easily locate stars and planets with it though. The vertical hold is great so it won't move around when little ones fight to see inside it and bump the table it is on. Honestly, the lenses aren't really made for more then just locating. The best I can say is you can see objects closer but certainly not in detail. But again as a kids first telescope I think it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Lis

customer_reviews.title: Great starter scope - get the add-on
customer_reviews.text: My mom got this for my 8 year old son for Christmas. We've had it out a few times and it is great. We also go the add-on with the finder scope and 2 extra lenses and I'm glad we did. The one big limitation is there is no way to attach a tripod, so the stand needs to sit on a table or other flat surface. We just take a folding table with us. Obviously, more advanced telescopes will have nicer features, but this is much better than I'd hoped for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Waylund

customer_reviews.title: The Most Adorable Newtonian Telescope
customer_reviews.text: The telecope is pretty small. So, it's definitely a tabletop telescope. The alt-az Dobsonian-type mount is very easy to use. The 3-inch aperture diameter is good for a beginner's telescope, and for the low price. It comes with a decent finderscope and two Kellner eyepieces: 20 mm (15x) and 10 mm (30x). You can see the moon's craters even with the lower-power eyepiece. I tried to use a separate 3x Barlow lens, but I couldn't see anything. Perhaps it's a focal-length issue. Overall, I recommend this telescope. It makes for a better child's X'mas present than a similarly priced refractor.
customer_reviews.author: Murray G Rosenberg

customer_reviews.title: Jupiter's 4 moons and Orion Nebula M42
customer_reviews.text: This is my first telescope and it lets me see saturn and Jupiter. It is fun and very light to take anywhere you want. I bring it to my oversea travel to look at Orion nebula in Penang (Second photo). To make it easy to pack, I replace the dobsonian base with a camera tripod and relocate the finder view. I used iPhone 6 and saturnCam app to capture the Jupiter and its 4 moons. I have also see Saturn but it is only a blob in an oval shape with 10mm eyepiece. I use SpiralCam app to photo the Orion Nebula.
customer_reviews.author: Yong54321

customer_reviews.title: The starter kit is essential
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty good telescope. However, you need the moon filter to look at the moon without frying your eyes (that thing is a lot brighter than you'd expect). But, you need the spotter to find anything else. So, just keep in mind that it costs $20 more than what you see here and you should be fine. It is still a great value
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Good gift and functional ornament.
customer_reviews.text: It works. But it will quickly become a functional desktop or shelf ornament if you want to actually see detail of the moon or anything in the night sky. Its a cool gift for young beginners and anyone who wants to decorate their room or office and wants a ornament to represent their interest in telescopes or astronomy.
customer_reviews.author: C.C

customer_reviews.title: keeper
customer_reviews.text: took this babe for a spin, and it was so easy to use, straight out of the box, there was no assembly needed. this is my first reflector telescope, and i love it. so much easier than the cheap refractor i have. i am happy with this purchase, the stars look clear, and as a small little telescope, i can somehow notice the orion nebula, so better lense could do some help. the planets are somewhat visible, since they look like stars. i am still trying this one out, but im glad to own it.
customer_reviews.author: Anzulove

customer_reviews.title: Small Reflector telescope
customer_reviews.text: This is a good little scope but it is almost impossible to get it aligned to anyhing smaller than the moon without a finder scope. We fixed this by adding a red dot finder sight and a mirror and screen so that the operator does not have to stand on his head to see through the finder. I would suggest a good refractor scope instead of this for a "first scope". Good lock.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Matthews

customer_reviews.title: Meh...
customer_reviews.text: I didnt realize a table top telescope would be so hard to maneuver. It took me almost 45 minutes to find the moon. I tried both lenses and have no clue how people can see past the moon to other objects. We could not find any planets even with the assist of an astronomy app. Directions were junk and un helpful.
customer_reviews.author: BJK

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Better than expected for the price. I am not big into astronomy, and this was a gift for my young boy. It is a lot easier for him than a tripod. much sturdier and he is able to see without needing some sort of stool to get high enough. I am very glad I went with this one. He loves and uses it more than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: doesn't even have instructions
customer_reviews.text: my 7yo asked santa for a telescope, so i purchased this one.. I know nothing about telescopes and this thing has no instructions. the mirror inside is hanging off and dangling, and after reading the comments, it seems i'm gonna have to figure out how to collimate it. no instructions= google detective and youtube watching. disappointed in purchase. wouldn't recommend unless you actually know how to use a telescope. two stars cuz it's not necessarily "broken".
customer_reviews.author: eVelasquez

customer_reviews.title: Great Value for a kid who is interested
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our 8 year old, and he loves it. He can't spot small things like planets on his own, but it isn't terribly difficult to get the hang of. For a starter scope, it has a nice image. Certainly not what you would get for something several times the price, but it is easy to transport and a comfortable investment for a child. Highly recommend for a beginner.
customer_reviews.author: HCinKC

customer_reviews.title: Great for watching the eclipse.
customer_reviews.text: WOW we watched the lunar eclipse the other night and were able to see the moon so clearly. For the money it's a terrific deal. My grandson is interested in astronomy for his future career (he's 11) . This unit is great as a first telescope, cause it's less expensive and easy to use. If he continues in his interest we'll get him a more expensive telescope.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ruined our Christmas morning
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with the glass broken, with shattered bits all over, I cut my hand pretty badly trying to get it out. Also, the entire unit was inexplicably dirty looking, like it had been rolled around on the ground before packing? I don’t know what that’s about, but my son was heartbroken when he opened it Christmas morning.
customer_reviews.author: Michaela Dickerson

customer_reviews.title: Better to use your own eyes than look through this thing, what a waste of money!
customer_reviews.text: What the hell? Really kind of upset. Both eye pieces are really no better than looking directly at the star or planet without the telescope. There is NO magnification at all. Am I missing something? How could there be so many good reviews? What a waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Chappy

customer_reviews.title: Returned...Did not work
customer_reviews.text: Did not work. Needed to be returned. Was a gift for our 7 year old son. Unfortunately even with instructions it was a lemon.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie S.

customer_reviews.title: Really love this little portable telescope
customer_reviews.text: My older son mentioned he'd like a telescope. Knowing that he is interested in something for about 10 minutes after he gets it I didn't want to overspend. Was pretty happy to find a well-rated scope at a great price. Once it was received I put it together (if you could call it that - not really anything to it) and he's been using it and enjoying it since. He's showed it to his friends and girlfriend and all have really enjoyed it. It's capable of more than it's set up with (eyepiece) so am considering upgrading that. If you don't want to spend big money on a serious piece of equipment, this is a nice first step.
customer_reviews.author: Scott C

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: I always wanted a telescope but I wanted something easy to set up that wasn't a lot of money. This is small, very easy to set up and I love that one is able to really see the moon, jupiter, saturn and mars really well. With the help of a sky app you can find objects in the sky. I have used it a number of times already and just love it. Just fyi I would pick up the Celestron 21024-ACC FirstScope Accessory Kit (Black) just for the moon filter and the Finderscope & bracket.
customer_reviews.author: K32531

customer_reviews.title: Perfect starter scope.
customer_reviews.text: The perfect starter scope. I added a HD camera tripod mount to the bottom by unbolting the swivel base and running the bolt thru both the base and the mount tab for the tripod. works either way now. And with the digital eyepiece I received for the microscope I purchased, with an adapter to take the eyepiece from 24mm to 32mm. Awsome.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: No clue what to say
customer_reviews.text: The truth is we are beginners and could never really truly figure out how to use this thing. We could never really see anything clearly - proceed with caution.
customer_reviews.author: SanD

customer_reviews.title: Great little scope
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my nephew who is 4. We love it. Plan on getting a couple cheap plossl EP's as the 2 supplied are very basic. I was surprised to fit the entire M45 into the field of view with a 40 degree 40mm eyepiece. Haven't collimated yet but views are good considering the price. We saw the Orion nebula from the front yard in town. Absolutely worth the price and it seems tough enough to handle some regular use.
customer_reviews.author: Adam k.

customer_reviews.title: Can’t see the moon
customer_reviews.text: It wasn’t easy to see the moon, still haven’t seen it, I seen across the way with it. I can see my neighbor’s house but that’s not what I’m trying to see, ain’t nobody got time for that weird stuff, I wanna see the moon
customer_reviews.author: Nicollette moss

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for kids/beginners
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a Christmas present for my 4 1/2 year old, and she is absolutely thrilled. Performance is fair - you definitely get more than you pay for with this, and you can build off of it with additional lenses, etc. The 20mm lens will get you some decent views of the moon, etc., with the 4mm a full moon will fill the field of view, craters, etc are very clearly visible. It may not be a "pro quality" scope, but is just right for kids - easy to carry around, not too expensive if it breaks, and I'll simply repeat - you MORE than get your money's worth out of this.
customer_reviews.author: W. T. Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Good for beginners
customer_reviews.text: My 9 year old is delighted to have this, and it's easy enough for everyone in the family to figure out how to use. Definitely buy the accesory kit though -- trying to sight anything smaller than the moon without the finderscope is an exercise in frustration, at least for someone like me who isn't experienced at all with telescopes.
customer_reviews.author: MelissaM

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: I'm not even a weekend astronomer, so take this for what it's worth. The moon is a blast with this thing. Bright, great clarity. If you're trying to view planets, well, you might be disappointed. If it's a tiny bright "star" in the sky, you're going to see a tiny magnified dot in the telescope. I've never been close to seeing rings, etc. Ok for my 6 year old, but he lost interest pretty quickly, as did I. Nothing wrong with the unit, seems to be well made. Just not very powerful. (Maybe it's not supposed to be for this price....)
customer_reviews.author: Wo0f3r

customer_reviews.title: Scope this out
customer_reviews.text: Very good beginners scope. although ours did not come with the sighting scope, and you really need one, this is a fun telescope. the optics are good and swivel base makes it pretty easy to track objects.
customer_reviews.author: radworks

customer_reviews.title: Bought for my girlfriend...
customer_reviews.text: As her first telescope, and she loves it. I've had some experience with Celestron (owning a 60GT), and have seen the moon up-close-and-personal plenty of times. The first time she was able to see distinct detail of the surface of the moon, she was extremely excited. That's what astronomy is about, to me; excitement -- looking up at the stars and moon and feeling a sense of wonder and awe. Celestron is great, and I plan on purchasing a new, higher-end scope from them in the next few years.
customer_reviews.author: Chris K

customer_reviews.title: great telescope for a kid
customer_reviews.text: The base for this works really well and the telescope works great too. This telescope did not cost very much and it very sturdy and usable unlike the kids telescopes I had. It works so well because it does not sit on a cheap tripod but instead on a lazy susan with a strong base and a heavy duty screw mechanism to control the up and down and a screw to control the resistance on the base. You just need to find a table or something to put this on. It looks like it will easily go into a backpack .
customer_reviews.author: beau thornburg

customer_reviews.title: This is a must have for average telescopes
customer_reviews.text: Great visuals using this lens, definitely more fun to take out my telescope now. Here is a screenshot of a video of the moon I took using an iPad camera.
customer_reviews.author: gurgen8or

customer_reviews.title: telescope is good, but came broken
customer_reviews.text: The box was damaged, telescope comes dirty . i don't understood what happens there....But the important thing is: the legs hole are broken, you can check pictures, unfortunately this is wooden side and i can't repair it. but the telescope is very good for beginners, good quality of mirrors.
customer_reviews.author: Kula

customer_reviews.title: a perfect fit!
customer_reviews.text: We did a lot of research before purchasing this telescope. I was looking at tripod versions and the most common complaint was that they were unsteady, especially for young children. It was a gift for our 8 year old grandson and he is loving it! Very easy to use and very well made.Would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Johnna

customer_reviews.title: Portability
customer_reviews.text: It is a simple telescope perfect for beginners of sky observation. Well designed, rigid, they are beautiful and the best thing is that you do not have to assemble anything but above all their portability is the most important thing!
customer_reviews.author: Hernando Rojas

customer_reviews.title: Great for a 7 year old who wants to see stars
customer_reviews.text: Santa delivered. The clouds cleared in time for us to use this before she had to go to bed. We were able to easily find the moon. Look forward to using it more. Worth looking into the accessory kit also!
customer_reviews.author: Glenn T.

customer_reviews.title: Telescope - no scope
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a gift for 7yr old. Details when ordering stated "ready to use" out of the box. There were no instructions and no lens for the scope, making it useless. To purchase the lens locally cost more than we spent on the telescope. The manufacturer was not helpful. Complete waste of money and disappointing gift
customer_reviews.author: kelly Matthews

customer_reviews.title: One of the best purchases I made this year
customer_reviews.text: This telescope was ready to roll right out of the box. Set up and locating the moon took just a minute or so. The magnification was much greater than the larger scope that I have and with the optics that are more of the standard sizes I am finally able to use my t-adapter for my camera. Waiting for the weather to clear to get some photos shot and had to buy a T-Adapter / Barlow Lens to get the camera to work. Cant wait for the next full moon to test this out. If you are looking for a starter telescope for a great price I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Gertog

customer_reviews.title: Excellent First Telescope
customer_reviews.text: My elementary school daughter has been interested in telescopes for over a year now. We had purchased a big box store telescope for about the same price. We almost never got it focused, and if we did it seemed to fall apart almost immediately. This telescope was the replacement. Our experience with with the Celestron telescope couldn't be more different. It is sturdy, and we had it focused and working within minutes of getting it out of the box. My daughter loves this telescope. I wish we had found this first!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: Hated it, awkward to set n use, couldn't use it well or see that good. Sorry not for me.
customer_reviews.author: The-Summers

customer_reviews.title: No view finder
customer_reviews.text: Has no view finder, and that makes finding your target alsmost impossible. Used it once, now it sits as a prop.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: She liked it
customer_reviews.text: Gift for granddaughter. Had to download stuff instead of being included in package.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Ackerman

customer_reviews.title: Well constructed terrestial scope.
customer_reviews.text: This scope, for the price I paid is exceptional. The quality and construction is great. Though a little difficult to point to smaller objects other than the moon, you do get used to it. The moon ended up a little too bright for my taste on a winter night sky in Seattle. I would definitely say that the accessory kit with the scope finder and the moon filter would eliminate and other difficulties you would have with the scope. If you plan on bird watching, I would suggest another scope as the first scope being a reflector causes you to view things upside-down. Overall, I'm happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: MikeAQ

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my gf who lives up in the mountains and showed interest in astronomy. It works great and it is super easy to use (though an included finder scope would have been great). I was worried that the low quality eye pieces would make it impossible to view plantes but I was able to find and focus on Jupiter quite easily (the image was a little blurry but I could make out the cloud bands with the 4mm eyepiece), I would recommend you get some cheap better quality eyepieces (specially the 4mm one), but it is a great first telescope for anyone who might think they are interested in astronomy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great entry level telescope
customer_reviews.text: I am a novice in the field of astronomy and bought this telescope very recently for my 7 year old son. In most of the reviews, I read that the provided 4mm eyepiece is not very useful. To be honest, I have used the telescope only to view the moon as of now. While observing the moon, I was able to see the details on the surface without losing much clarity. I avoided seeing it during the full moon phase, which may have been a reason for that. Overall, I feel it is a great value for the price I paid for it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Rathod

customer_reviews.title: Attached my green laser in place of spotting scope, ...
customer_reviews.text: Attached my green laser in place of spotting scope, velcro'd and old android to the back siderunning Google Sky Night mode for instant identification, and a CCD USB camera to the optic from a small laptop for ease of viewing. Sit back,relax, look, search. No more bending over all night
customer_reviews.author: SPerthou

customer_reviews.title: Good for beginners but can’t see much
customer_reviews.text: It’s good for beginners. You can see the moon pretty good. And other stars just look like dots. Returned and going to spend a lot more on a decent telescope that can see more
customer_reviews.author: justin c

customer_reviews.title: Family friendly
customer_reviews.text: Really great for family fun night, especially with expected meteor showers in August!
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen R

customer_reviews.title: Great. Beginner scope of Telrad isadded
customer_reviews.text: Great beginners scope IF you add a secondary red dot finder. I recommend a Telrad.
customer_reviews.author: Marvin Huddleston

customer_reviews.title: Arrived Damaged Twice
customer_reviews.text: Arrived damaged TWICE! If it can’t survive shipping, not sure how long it will last if we finally get one to arrive unharmed. We bought as Christmas gift for nephew so we’ll be trying for a third and last time only because he was really excited about it.
customer_reviews.author: Sheri

customer_reviews.title: Celestron did it again..
customer_reviews.text: This is a VERY affordable telescope for the beginner, be it adult or child. I got this one for my 10 year old Grand Daughter and it's every bit as good as one I purchased in the mid 70's that was much larger, heavier and bulkier.. Decent optics and a clear view for such an inexpensive telescope. Well worth the small investment to make a kid happy.
customer_reviews.author: Billy J.

customer_reviews.title: awesome entry level...
customer_reviews.text: I remember watching the stars with my dad as a child and now that I have kids, I look forward to enjoying warm summer nights outside watching the stars with my kids. We have only been able to look at the moon from inside due to the cold but they have enjoyed it as much as I remember. What imaginations little ones have...they love looking for the man in the moon. I've also ordered additional eye pieces to increase the power of this telescope as the 2 that come with the product are too weak to view more than the moon but for the price, this product can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Galyon

customer_reviews.title: Perfect first scope
customer_reviews.text: This is called a first scope and it was my first scope. It was very easy for a newbie to use. The swivel is surprisingly stable. The scope is well built and has a hard plastic coating to it. I was looking at the moon in no time and admiring the details. I think this is the best scope in its price range. Be warned though....this scope can ignite an interest in a very expensive hobby and you'll be wanting a much larger and pricey scope in no time after seeing what this can do! :)
customer_reviews.author: alter

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner's and kid's telescope
customer_reviews.text: My six-year-old asked for a telescope for Christmas. Neither my husband nor I are experienced with telescopes, but this is very easy to use. We viewed the last lunar eclipse with this, and it worked so well. We are very happy with our purchase, and my daughter loves it as well.
customer_reviews.author: D. Chase

customer_reviews.title: I must be doing something wrong
customer_reviews.text: would have been nice if they included direction. I downloaded and printed the manual and still couldn'g see anything. I don't think it's broken...I must be stooped. I guess I'll call the company and see if they can suggest something. There is a DVD and some additional material that one can purchase. Would be nice if they included that in the price. Otherwise I have a fifty dollar paperweight impersonating a telescope.
customer_reviews.author: fatty fatty two by four

customer_reviews.title: Needs tripod mount option
customer_reviews.text: Awesome scope for a beginner. I wish it came with a tripod mount though. That would make this a lot more versital
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: here comes jupiter and the moons!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: simply the best single thing we have acquired in a long time- it really really works! we live in a light polluted area, but were easily able to find jupiter and several moons! This is not a toy, but would be excellent for anyone from age 5 to 115- it takes a little patience, and if someone has a smart phone with a sky app to find things to center for the scope that makes it a lot easier- highly recommend this quality item!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small magnification
customer_reviews.text: Good product and quality for the price but the magnification is disappointing. Even a full moon doesn't fill completely the viewfinder using the 10mm eyepiece. Only the 6mm in the optional accessory kit does but it is much more difficult to position and focus.
customer_reviews.author: Rodrigo

customer_reviews.title: defective
customer_reviews.text: one of the bottom screw-in legs had fallen out while it was still in the package, and the hole it had been in was thrashed and ruined, so the telescope sits at a slant... i'm probably just going to remove the other two legs but it kind of sucked. also no real directions....
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Callaham

customer_reviews.title: Great for the deck
customer_reviews.text: This is a portable, user friendly telescope that has good optical quality. Can be easily moved from one position to another because it's so light, short and mounted on a stable revolving stand. It's just right for someone who wants to pull out a telescope without a major production and be able to use the 2 lenses provided to spot and look more closely at far away objects. Priced like a toy, but is a serious telescope for casual user. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Gene

customer_reviews.title: see the sky at a budget with a FirstScope by Celestron.
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be happier with my Celestron Scope. after using this for a while I will upgrade to a more progressive Scope. Thank you very much.
customer_reviews.author: steven marquez

customer_reviews.title: Good first scope
customer_reviews.text: For a first scope for a younger kid, this is a good pickup. You won't see everything like you would in an expensive, larger scope, but we've taken good pictures of the moon, and seen the moons of Jupiter and the rings of Saturn through this little guy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not Just For Kids!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great starter scope for all ages! I bought it over a year ago for my brothers 16th birthday. It was his first telescope. He was extremely excited and still uses it all the time. It travels well (given it's size) and is very easy to use. Celestron is a good company and for my brothers 17th birthday I bought him a bigger more high powered telescope. This telescope is great for all ages and experience levels! I highly recommend it, as a first scope or an addition to a collection!
customer_reviews.author: LTL446

customer_reviews.title: Arrived broken twice.  Bad design.
customer_reviews.text: Twice I ordered this item, and twice it arrived with a broken foot. The base of the telescope is made of cheap particle board, and the wood screws that attach the feet to the base are too short. Bad design.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Theis

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner scope for a young astronomer
customer_reviews.text: Great beginner scope for a young astronomer. My 8 year old loves it. I totally recommend ordering the finderscope for another 18 bux plus tax and shipping. This finderscope is a must have to aim without frustrating yourself to no end! The telescope is well made and works great.
customer_reviews.author: J.L

customer_reviews.title: OK for beginner
customer_reviews.text: Good for moon. Difficult to see planets (very small)c-can be frustrating for young astronomer.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Grieco

customer_reviews.title: Great for novices
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a telescope for my young kids just to get them started. This scope had great reviews and was a excellent value so decided to try it out. It would have been nice to have a spotting scope (in retrospect) b/c it's hard to find stuff in the sky. Like how you can upgrade the optics if you get more serious. Very compact, great for camping.
customer_reviews.author: ProductSense

customer_reviews.title: Great first telescope!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this telescope. I got it for him for his birthday as he is an astronomy hobbyist. It doesn't get the clear definition of images like the larger telescopes do, but it will get you started until you can afford one of those larger ones.
customer_reviews.author: slosson02

customer_reviews.title: Average...
customer_reviews.text: Came to me broken. One of the legs snapped off. Needs to be wrapped better as its made of ultra cheap fibro wood.
customer_reviews.author: Mick

customer_reviews.title: OH HEAVENS!
customer_reviews.text: What a great little starter to sample the moon, stars, and the wonders of the heavens. My son wanted to kick start some interest above and this was an easy solution. There is no assembly required; and the base swivels around and the tilt up and down is easy. A small price to see a lot from above. I very rarely give five stars, but this one deserves it. Prime shipping had me gazing above in two days. Winner!
customer_reviews.author: C. Carmichael

customer_reviews.title: strictly for moon observation. needs extra pieces to get good image
customer_reviews.text: This is good for only moon gazing. I bought two extra optics a Barlow and a nice eye piece. Without then u básically have a toy. It's very lighy and portable so if you go camping light and just want to see the moon and nothing else take this. It's hard to align and keep in place because it's so light. It's good for toddlers that want you to help then see the moon.
customer_reviews.author: Sean J. Valadez

customer_reviews.title: Mom I like all my presents but where's my telescope
customer_reviews.text: My grandson had a wonderful time opening and playing with all his new presents, but when the dust settled he asked his Mom where his telescope is. When he came to our house on Christmas day the look on his face when he got his telescope was priceless. The look and feel of the telescope is very nice. How well it works is yet to be determined and once he uses it i will come back and post an update.
customer_reviews.author: JACK ENGLISH

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Telescope

Being that the price is so low, the lenses that come with it are not high quality. I also purchased the Celestron Accessory Kit 1.25" lenses with it and I am very happy with the results. This is a quality item for a beginner.

customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I had really high hopes
customer_reviews.text: Based on the reviews from others, I was hoping that this would be THE gift for my daughter for Christmas. She was incredibly excited when she opened it and couldn't wait for nightfall so she could try it out. However when we took it outdoors to look at the stars and the moon, we were disappointed. After trying to focus on many different stars and the moon, we weren't able to truly see anything. The best view we got was a blurry pinpoint of light. On the bright side, she loves to use it to look at faraway objects in our home.

customer_reviews.title: Quality just isn't there.
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't expecting much out of this telescope for the price, but it's still a bit of a disappointment. I wish I had paid a little more and got something a better. Pros: - Size - Simplicity: easy for my 7 year old to use. - Price Cons: - I have to hold the focusing dial in place otherwise it slowly falls out of focus, this makes it difficult to get something in focus for my kids and then step away so they can look. - The image quality with the 4mm eyepiece is pretty poor. The very center is somewhat clear, but the majority of the image seems distorted.

customer_reviews.title: Solid starter 'scope

product_meta.title: Celestron 21023 Cometron FirstScope (White)
product_meta.description: Style:Cometron FirstScope| Configuration:Telescope OnlyBe ready for the next big comet with Celestron’s special-edition Cometron FirstScope, a compact, lightweight telescope that’s perfect for beginners looking to experience the magic of a dazzling comet, planet, or nebula. This tabletop Dobsonian-style telescope includes a spherical mirror with a generous 76 mm of aperture. The Cometron FirstScope provides bright, sharp views of comets and other celestial objects, and renders the Moon’s mountains and craters in crisp detail. And thanks to its wide field of view, you’ll be able to observe the brightest part of the comet and its tail or favorite deep-sky objects like the Orion Nebula. The Cometron FirstScope offers several upgrades from the original Celestron FirstScope, including 2 Kellner eyepieces and a 5x24 finderscope. Weighing just 4.3 lbs, the Cometron FirstScope is a tabletop telescope that you can take on all your outdoor adventures. It’s also stylish enough to be a decorative fixture on your bookshelf or desk.
